result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin J Muniz

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed:  State's Motion in Limine.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Motions in Limine.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Amended Supplemental Witness List

Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. 
Expires 12-13-2022

Defendant Kevin J Muniz not in court, in custody.  Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons Ms in court for Kevin J Muniz.  Attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense entered a speedy trial demand.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by 10-12-2022 and all responses to be filed by 11-09-2022 or they will be deemed waived.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Kevin J Muniz not in court, in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for bail/bond hearing.  Bail motions by the State and Defense argued and denied by the Court.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons appeared by video means for defendant Kevin J Muniz not in court, in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for status.  Defense requests to be heard on bail.  Due to connection issues, Court set a bail/bond hearing date to be held in person in Room 634 of the Courthouse.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Kevin J Muniz in court with Attorney Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons; both appear by video.  Defendant Kevin J Muniz in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Court took judicial notice of 20CF1941. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: South Milwaukee Officer L. Staege. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40 to track with 20CF1941 that is set this morning.  Status conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed:  Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail.

Attorney Heather Johnson on behalf of Melissa Jane Fitzsimmons in court, defendant Kevin J Muniz not in court, in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Fitzsimmons is in trial. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Jaqueline J-H.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.
  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD DUE TO TECHNICAL ISSUES:
 Defendant Kevin J Muniz in court with attorney Joan Elizabeth Zawikowski.  Defendant Kevin J Muniz in custody.  Annie Louk appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
